title: Sights and scenes in Europe :
author: Stevenson, William.
snippet: There are many fine statues of distinguished Belgians in the public squares and streets, in which, as an American, I felt but little interest. The Martyrs' Monument, in the Place des Martyres, is quite elaborate, and is in honor of the Belgians who fell in the battles with the Dutch, September  23-4, 1830. It contains the names of 448 men, who fell at that time.
